title: Why electric vehicle battery production could be the saviour of UK automotive
text:
Part 1 of our week-long series on the electric vehicle (EV) revolution looked at the world's readiness for a switch to electric vehicles. Part 2 revealed the impact on global mining for the rare earth elements required to manufacture EVs. Here we look how EV battery production will be integral to much of the UK's future economic prospects in the years to come.

Minutes after he entered Downing Street as Prime Minister for the first time, Boris Johnson made a point of singling out one area where British scientists were, in his words, “leading the world”: electric vehicle batteries.
